english: You have the right to perform your actions, but never to the fruits of action.
explanation: This fundamental teaching reminds us to focus on our duties without attachment to results. True peace comes from doing our best while surrendering outcomes to the Divine.

english: Yoga is skill in action.
explanation: Real yoga isn't just physical postures—it's performing every action with awareness, dedication, and spiritual consciousness. This transforms ordinary work into sacred practice.

sanskrit: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु
english: Always think of Me, become My devotee, worship Me and offer your homage unto Me.
explanation: By keeping our mind focused on the Divine in all activities, we transform our entire life into a spiritual practice, finding peace in constant connection with God.

english: Abandon all varieties of religion and just surrender unto Me.
explanation: When we surrender our ego and personal desires to the Divine will, we find ultimate liberation from anxiety and discover true peace that surpasses understanding.

sanskrit: यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत
english: Whenever and wherever there is a decline in righteousness, I manifest Myself.
explanation: The Divine presence emerges in times of darkness and confusion. Even in our personal struggles, this divine consciousness can manifest to guide us toward light.

english: As a person puts on new garments, giving up old ones, the soul similarly accepts new material bodies, giving up the old and useless ones.
explanation: Understanding the eternal nature of the soul helps us overcome fear of change and loss. We are not this temporary body but the eternal consciousness within.

sanskrit: क्लैब्यं मा स्म गमः पार्थ नैतत्त्वय्युपपद्यते
english: Do not yield to impotence, O Arjuna. It does not befit you.
explanation: We must not give in to weakness or despair. Every soul has divine strength within. When we connect to this inner power, we can face any challenge with courage.

english: One must deliver himself with the help of his mind, and not degrade himself.
explanation: We are responsible for our own spiritual elevation. Through disciplined thinking and positive mental cultivation, we can lift ourselves from suffering to joy.

english: A person who is not disturbed by the incessant flow of desires can alone achieve peace.
explanation: True peace comes not from getting what we want, but from maintaining equanimity whether we experience pleasure or pain, gain or loss.

english: Work done as a sacrifice for the Divine frees one from bondage.
explanation: When we offer our actions to the Divine rather than working for personal gain, our work becomes worship and we find freedom from stress and ego.

english: The wise grieve neither for the living nor the dead.
explanation: Understanding the eternal nature of consciousness helps us transcend grief. The wise see beyond temporary forms to the imperishable essence of life.

sanskrit: नासतो विद्यते भावो नाभावो विद्यते सतः
english: That which is real never ceases to be; that which is unreal never comes into being.
explanation: This profound truth helps us distinguish between the temporary and eternal. Our worries are temporary, but our true spiritual nature is permanent and peaceful.

english: When a man is satisfied in himself by himself, he is said to be in transcendence.
explanation: True contentment comes from within, not from external possessions or achievements. Self-realization brings the deepest satisfaction and lasting peace.

english: While contemplating the objects of the senses, attachment for them arises.
explanation: Our thoughts create our reality. By controlling what we dwell upon, we can free ourselves from unwanted attachments and find inner freedom.

english: One who is free from attachment and aversion can attain tranquility.
explanation: Peace comes when we can engage with life without being controlled by likes and dislikes. This balanced approach brings serenity in all circumstances.

english: The mode of goodness brings happiness and knowledge.
explanation: Cultivating goodness, purity, and positive qualities naturally leads to joy and wisdom. This is the path to transforming our mental state from darkness to light.

english: Better is one's own duty, though imperfectly performed, than the duty of another well performed.
explanation: Authenticity brings peace. Rather than comparing ourselves to others, we find fulfillment by honestly following our own path and purpose in life.

english: The bewildered soul thinks himself the doer of activities.
explanation: Ego creates suffering. When we recognize that we are instruments of a higher power, we find freedom from the burden of thinking we control everything.

sanskrit: नियतं कुरु कर्म त्वं कर्म ज्यायो ह्यकर्मणः
english: You should perform your prescribed duties, for action is better than inaction.
explanation: Purposeful action aligned with dharma brings growth and peace. Even small positive actions are better than paralysis from overthinking or fear.

sanskrit: यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति
english: One who sees Me everywhere and sees everything in Me never loses sight of Me.
explanation: This divine vision transforms ordinary life into sacred experience. When we see the Divine presence in all beings and situations, we live in constant connection and peace.

english: One who sees the equal soul in all beings attains the highest.
explanation: True wisdom sees the same divine consciousness in every person. This universal love and respect dissolves barriers and brings profound inner peace.

english: Therefore, always perform your duty efficiently and without attachment.
explanation: Excellence without attachment is the secret to both success and peace. We can be fully engaged in life while remaining spiritually free and centered.

english: Treating pleasure and pain, gain and loss, victory and defeat as equal, engage in battle.
explanation: Emotional equilibrium is the foundation of peace. When we don't get carried away by life's ups and downs, we maintain our center and act with wisdom.

english: To those who worship Me with devotion, meditating on Me alone, I provide what they lack and preserve what they have.
explanation: Sincere devotion creates divine protection and provision. When we focus our love on the Divine, our needs are naturally fulfilled in perfect timing.

sanskrit: मामेवैष्यसि सत्यं ते प्रतिजाने प्रियोऽसि मे
english: You will come to Me alone; this I promise you truly, for you are dear to Me.
explanation: The Divine love for each soul is personal and unconditional. This assurance brings comfort that we are never alone and always guided toward our highest good.

english: Out of compassion for them, I destroy the darkness born of ignorance with the lamp of knowledge.
explanation: Divine grace actively works to enlighten us. Our sincere seeking invites this transformative wisdom that dissolves confusion and reveals truth.

english: No one who performs good deeds ever comes to grief.
explanation: Every positive action, however small, contributes to our spiritual progress. Good intentions and kind acts create protective karma that guides us toward happiness.

english: One who is satisfied with gain that comes of its own accord is free from duality and envy.
explanation: Contentment with what life brings naturally creates peace. When we stop forcing outcomes and trust the flow of life, we find unexpected joy and freedom.

english: Being free from expectation and possessiveness, fight without anxiety.
explanation: Action without attachment to ownership or results eliminates stress. We can be fully engaged in our responsibilities while remaining peaceful and free.

english: One who sees the Supreme Lord dwelling equally in all beings never destroys the Self by the self.
explanation: This divine vision prevents self-destruction through negative thinking or harmful actions. Seeing God in all beings naturally leads to self-love and respect for life.

english: A person engaged in devotional service rids himself of both good and bad reactions in this life.
explanation: Transcending the duality of good and bad karma, the spiritually awakened person finds freedom from the cycle of action and reaction through divine grace.

english: Surrender unto Him utterly. By His grace you will attain transcendental peace.
explanation: Complete surrender to Divine will is the ultimate path to peace. When we stop trying to control everything and trust completely, we find perfect tranquility.

english: The Supreme Lord is situated in everyone's heart, directing the wanderings of all living entities.
explanation: The Divine presence within our own heart is our constant guide and companion. This inner connection is always available to provide direction and comfort.

english: One who sees himself in all beings and all beings in himself attains the highest.
explanation: This expanded consciousness dissolves the illusion of separation. When we feel connected to all life, we naturally experience love, compassion, and inner peace.

english: It is said that the soul is invisible, inconceivable and immutable.
explanation: Understanding our true nature as eternal consciousness beyond physical form brings freedom from fear and identification with temporary circumstances.

sanskrit: जातस्य हि ध्रुवो मृत्युरध्रुवं जन्म मृतस्य च
english: For one who has taken birth, death is certain; and for one who is dead, birth is certain.
explanation: Accepting the natural cycles of life reduces our resistance to change. This wisdom helps us flow with life's transitions rather than fighting the inevitable.

sanskrit: नैनं छिन्दन्ति शस्त्राणि नैनं दहति पावकः
english: The soul can never be cut by weapons, nor burned by fire.
explanation: Our essential nature is indestructible and eternal. This knowledge gives us the courage to face any challenge, knowing our true self cannot be harmed.

english: The yogis, abandoning attachment, act only for the purification of the self.
explanation: Every action can become a spiritual practice when done with the right intention. This transforms ordinary activities into opportunities for inner growth and purification.

sanskrit: न मे पार्थास्ति कर्तव्यं त्रिषु लोकेषु किञ्चन
english: There is no work prescribed for Me in all the three planetary systems, yet I am engaged in work.
explanation: Even the Divine engages in action not from need but from love and duty. This teaches us to act from service and love rather than compulsion or necessity.

english: By sacrifice you shall prosper, and it shall fulfill your desires.
explanation: When we give selflessly and make offerings of our time, energy, and resources, we create abundance and fulfillment in return through the law of cosmic reciprocity.

sanskrit: अनाश्रितः कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति यः
english: One who performs duty without attachment to the fruits of action is a sannyasi and a yogi.
explanation: True renunciation is not giving up action but giving up attachment to results. This mental attitude transforms any lifestyle into a spiritual path.

english: One who is equal in honor and dishonor, who is content with whatever comes naturally, is very dear to Me.
explanation: Freedom from the opinions of others brings tremendous peace. When our happiness doesn't depend on praise or criticism, we find unshakeable contentment.

sanskrit: द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च
english: There are two kinds of beings in this world: the divine and the demoniac.
explanation: We each have the choice to cultivate divine or negative qualities. By consciously choosing compassion, truth, and service, we align with our higher nature.

english: Fearlessness, purification of existence, cultivation of spiritual knowledge—these are divine qualities.
explanation: Developing these divine qualities naturally leads to peace and strength. Each day we can choose to cultivate fearlessness, purity, and wisdom in our thoughts and actions.

english: Divine nature leads to liberation, while demoniac nature leads to bondage.
explanation: Our mental qualities determine our freedom or bondage. By choosing thoughts and actions aligned with love, truth, and service, we naturally move toward liberation.

english: One who finds satisfaction within himself, who rejoices within himself, is truly happy.
explanation: The greatest happiness comes from inner contentment rather than external achievements. Self-satisfaction based on spiritual connection brings lasting joy and peace.

english: Those who are free from desire and anger, whose minds are controlled, attain the brahmic state.
explanation: Mastery over desire and anger leads to spiritual realization. These two emotions are the greatest obstacles to peace, and their transcendence brings divine consciousness.

english: You should also act for the welfare of the world.
explanation: Individual spiritual growth is connected to service to others. When we work for the benefit of all beings, our own spiritual evolution is accelerated and fulfilled.

english: The devotees who eat only the remnants of sacrifice are freed from all sins.
explanation: Taking only what we need and offering the rest creates spiritual purification. This principle of sacred economics brings both material sufficiency and spiritual growth.

english: To deliver the pious and to annihilate the miscreants, I appear millennium after millennium.
explanation: The force of good ultimately prevails in the universe. This cosmic law gives us confidence that our positive efforts are supported by divine power and will succeed.

sanskrit: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते
english: I am the source of all; everything emanates from Me.
explanation: Understanding the divine source of all existence brings perspective to our problems. When we see everything as manifestations of one consciousness, we find unity and peace.
